entry.title: Biden Administration Divided as Food Crisis Related to Ukraine War Looms
entry.content: At issue is a plan calling for Belarus to help move grain to market, with a six-month waiver of sanctions on its potash fertilizer industry offered as an incentive.

entry.title: Russia Is Weaponizing Food Supplies, Europe Says
entry.content: European officials blamed Moscow for a looming global food crisis as Russia’s blockade of Ukrainian ports threatens the country’s grain exports, while fighting rages in the east.

entry.title: Sweden's NATO Bid Rattles Kurdish Diaspora
entry.content: Turkey is blocking Sweden’s bid to join NATO over Stockholm’s contacts with Kurdish groups hoping to carve out a homeland straddling the borders of Turkey and Syria.

entry.title: In Russia's Battle for East Ukraine, Both Sides Have Higher Stakes at Play
entry.content: Moscow aims to prove it can gain and retain territory, while Ukraine wants to show some wary Western allies that it has a chance of prevailing against bigger Russian forces.
